greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows, partial sums from the right an A010892 subsequences decrescendo triangle
comment: n-th row = (n+1) terms of an infinitely periodic cycle: (...1, 0, 0, 1, 2, 2, 1, 0, 0, 1, 2, 2, 1), shifting to the right one place for the next row
formula: Construct an A010892 decrescendo triangle: (1; 1,1; 0,1,1; -1,0,1,1;...) and take partial sums starting from the right.
example: First few rows of the triangle =
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Sep 10 2008
